stem: A 28-year-old client with diagnosed HELLP syndrome suddenly reports 'tearing' pain in her Right Upper Quadrant (RUQ) followed by a sharp drop in blood pressure. Based on the documentation in the Critical OB & Hepatic Surgical Log tab, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Acute cardiovascular collapse in a preeclamptic patient.
Background: HELLP syndrome (Platelets 32,000, AST 450).
Assessment: Client is now pulseless/grey. Significant abdominal distention noted in the RUQ.
Recommendation: Immediate surgery for liver rupture.

tabs.content: BP 52/30, HR 162, RR 32. Skin is cool and clammy.

actionOptions.text: Initiate Massive Transfusion Protocol (MTP) with PRBCs, Platelets, and FFP
Prepare the client for emergent Laparotomy for surgical liver repair
Carry out an aggressive fundal massage to stop the bleeding
Position the client flat on her back (Supine) to ease abdominal pain

parameterOptions.text: Abdominal girth and Right Upper Quadrant (RUQ) pain intensity
Blood pressure and heart rate (Hemorrhagic shock trends)
Daily measurement of fasting serum glucose
Presence of a positive Babinski sign

rationale.correct: This is a Subcapsular Hepatic Hematoma leading to Hepatic Rupture (c2), a rare but high-mortality complication of HELLP syndrome. The liver enzymes in HELLP are high because the liver is swelling; if it swells too much, the capsule 'tears' (RUQ pain) and ruptures into the peritoneum. This causes rapid Hypovolemic Shock (BP 52/30). Priority actions are MTP (a1) to replace volume/factors and immediate surgery (a2). Key parameters include tracking the distending abdomen (p1) and shock vitals (p2).
clinicalPearls: In HELLP, 'epigastric pain' is actually 'liver pain.' If it becomes sharp/tearing, the capsule has likely ruptured.
Hepatic rupture has a maternal mortality rate of ~25â€“50%.
Massive transfusion protocol (MTP) is essential because the patient also has very low platelets from HELLP.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking the bleeding is coming from the uterus.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: If the pain is in the RUQ (Liver area) and the patient has HELLP syndrome, the bleeding is likely the liver, not the uterus. Fundal massage will do nothing for a bleeding liver.

mnemonic.title: HELLP-Pop
mnemonic.expansion: Liver swells, then it pops. Ruptured liver, pressure drops.
